meta.title: Whitney Point Central School District Home

form.name: form1

strong.span: The NYS Governor has ordered all public schools, including Whitney Point,
to be closed through May 15 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

span.strong: For information on at-home learning, meal distribution and more,
scroll down to the center of this page to the "Closure Information" section.

p.style: color: White; font-size: 20px; padding-left: 19px; margin-bottom: -2px; font-weight: bold; color: Yellow;
color: White; font-size: 20px; padding-left: 19px; margin-bottom: -2px; font-weight: bold; color: Yellow;

br.span: Whitney Point High School's Class of 2020 were surprised Saturday morning by a team of wonderful volunteers who drove throughout the district to place special yard signs on the lawns at each senior's home. The signs say "Home of a Whitney Point High School Senior" and "Class of 2020". It was a great way to recognize our seniors, who are missing out on some of the traditional year-end events. Click headline for photo gallery.

Whitney Point High School graduate Emma Maslin was recently featured on WBNG-TV news regarding her work as a nurse dealing with COVID-19 patients at Duke University. We are so proud of Emma's achievements, courage and dedication! See WBNG-TV coverage here.

Please note that the Board of Education meeting originally scheduled for May 5, 2020 has been canceled. The Budget Hearing also scheduled for May 5, 2020 has been postponed to a later date to be determined.

Local PBS station WSKG has developed new programming to help students who are now learning at home. Grade-level programs are broadcast from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday. To view the program schedule for April 20-24, click here. To see WSKG's World program schedule click here.

The Food Bank of the Southern Tier will hold a Community Food Distribution from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. on Wednesday, April 15 at the High School. Participants must register in advance, receive a confirmation number and have access to a vehicle. See flyer for details.

div.span: Notice of Change in BOE Proceedings

br.span: Please see important information regarding changes to Board of Education meetings, budget hearing and elections. Click here to view notice.

em.strong: To be a community of excellence achieved through a commitment to high performance, morale, & involvement

strong.span: A Message from Superintendent Dr. Patricia Follette:

span.p: As you are aware, all schools in Broome County are closed due Governor Cuomo's Executive Order in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Here at Whitney Point schools, we understand the challenges that this poses for so many of you, and we are commited to doing all we can to help our students and families navigate this new reality. For information on at-home learning, meal distribution and more, please see the center section of this home page, under "Closure Information".

td.a: Destination D.C. Parent Mtg. - CANCELED: SCHOOLS CLOSED
TRA 4th & 5th Grade Concert - CANCELED: SCHOOLS CLOSED
TRA Drama Club trip to NYC-CANCELED

div.h3: Sign up for WPCSD Text Alerts

p.img: If you are a parent or guardian and are not currently receiving text alerts from the Whitney Point School District and would like to, please email [email protected] or call 607-692-8269 to provide the cell phone number you would like to use. You will receive an opt-in message from school messenger, please respond " yes" to receive future alerts.

div.div: 10 Keibel Rd. Whitney Point, NY 13862 | P 607.692.8202 | F 607.692.4434
